page.title: 01Introduction to Hoo area
page.content: The villages of Brandeston,kettleburgh, Hoo and parts of Letheringham & Monewden are contained within this area,an area characterised by fields,fields of rape,bright yellow when in flower,highly perfumed fields of beans,peas grown for freezing,sugar beet & even fruit-particularly black currants,but very little grazing land. Villages are small,just one or two large enough to support a shop which is a general atore-cum-post office,centre of village news but very helpful when customers are unable to get out to shop. None of these villages now has a school so every child has to be trans- ported to school.Between larger villages are small hamlets of 6-12 houses & a church,& a few isolated houses standing completely on their own.
